intro: Helianthemum croceum var. virens, commonly known as the green-flowered rockrose, is a low-growing shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features small, upright stems covered in dense, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and full sun exposure. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping.
